Observation: Largely forest and pasture. Small town footprint.
Criteria: <5% impervious

Observation: Suburban neighborhoods with scattered commercial areas.
Criteria: ~5-10% impervious

Observation: Mixed suburban and commercial corridors.
Criteria: 10-20% impervious

Observation: Urban core and arterial corridors dominate lower basin.
Criteria: >20% impervious

Observation: Few local roads. Rare stream crossings.
Criteria: <0.5 km roads/km2

Observation: Collector roads present. Some drainage ditches.
Grid network near town center. Several culvert crossings.
Criteria: 1-2 km/km2

Observation: Highways and frontage roads crisscross basin. Frequent crossings to channel.
Criteria: >2 km/km2

Observation: Stable land cover since 2001. Minor field rotations only.
Criteria: <5% area converted (e.g., 2001-2019)

Observation: New subdivisions on outskirts.
Criteria: 5-15% converted

Observation: Widespread exurban growth and clearing.
Criteria: ~15-30% converted

Observation: Major urban expansion or large agricultural conversion.
Criteria: >=30% converted

Observation: No major dams. Only small farm ponds far upstream.
Criteria: None or negligible influence

Observation: One small off-channel dam upstream. Limited storage.
Criteria: 1-2 small dams, partial influence

Observation: Several moderate impoundments in series.
Criteria: Multiple moderate dams affecting peaks/baseflow

Observation: Large reservoir close upstream with hydropeaking or strict seasonal rule curves.
Criteria: Heavily regulated system

Observation: Wetlands within mapped floodplain or valley bottom
Criteria: High (>5% of floodplain area)

Observation: Moderate (~2-5%)
Criteria: Moderate (~2-5%)

Observation: Very low (<1%)
Criteria: Very low (<1%)

Observation: Overbanking frequency based on field indicators and gage context
Criteria: Floodplain engages at ~1-2 yr or 2-5 yr events

Observation: Overbanking requires slightly larger than bankfull but not rare
Criteria: Overbanking requires slightly larger than bankfull but not rare

Observation: Overbanking mainly at ~5-10 yr events. Partial disconnection
Criteria: Overbanking mainly at ~5-10 yr events. Partial disconnection

Observation: Rarely or never overbanking below ~10-yr events. Incision or levees present
Criteria: Rarely or never overbanking below ~10-yr events. Incision or levees present

Observation: Beaver dams or small ponds relative to natural capacity
Criteria: Present where expected. Enhance baseflow and habitat. Minimal fragmentation

Observation: One to two small obstructions. Minor impacts
Criteria: One to two small obstructions. Minor impacts

Observation: Multiple ponds that moderately disrupt connectivity
Criteria: Multiple ponds that moderately disrupt connectivity

Observation: Widespread channel fragmentation or overabundant ponding
Criteria: Widespread channel fragmentation or overabundant ponding

Observation: Side channels, oxbows, and beaver wetlands connected near bankfull
Criteria: Multiple features connect during moderate (bankfull) floods

Observation: Partial connection or few off-channel areas
Criteria: Partial connection or few off-channel areas

Observation: Only large floods (>5-10 yr) access these areas
Criteria: Only large floods (>5-10 yr) access these areas

Observation: Off-channel features mostly gone or permanently cut off
Criteria: Off-channel features mostly gone or permanently cut off

Observation: Outfalls or ditches per 100 m
Outfalls or ditches per 100 m
Outfalls or ditches per 100 m
Outfalls or ditches per 100 m
Stability and turbidity at confluences during storms
Criteria: Mostly natural tributaries with stable flows and typical sediment loads

Observation: One or two moderately altered tributaries with occasional elevated turbidity
Criteria: One or two moderately altered tributaries with occasional elevated turbidity

Observation: Multiple significantly altered tributaries with frequent sediment plumes
Criteria: Multiple significantly altered tributaries with frequent sediment plumes

Observation: Widespread severely altered tributaries or severe pollution at many confluences
Criteria: Widespread severely altered tributaries or severe pollution at many confluences

Observation: Withdrawals and return flows near the reach
Criteria: No significant withdrawals or returns

Observation: Minor ditches or returns with limited effect
Criteria: Minor ditches or returns with limited effect

Observation: Moderate diversions or large returns that cause seasonal stress
Criteria: Moderate diversions or large returns that cause seasonal stress

Observation: Large or chronic diversions or major returns that alter the flow regime
Criteria: Large or chronic diversions or major returns that alter the flow regime

Observation: Road or highway outfalls per 100 m
Road or highway outfalls per 100 m
Road or highway outfalls per 100 m
Road or highway outfalls per 100 m
Criteria: >=5 or a major highway outfall

Observation: SDAM class, bed vegetation, mean annual flow, and flowing-days data (if available) match reference.
Criteria: Flow duration class matches expected; mean annual flow and flowing days within ~10% of baseline.

Observation: Minor but consistent departures across indicators.
Criteria: About 10-20% change in mean annual flow or flowing days, or slightly more/less bed vegetation than expected.

Observation: Substantial sustained shift in dryness or baseflow.
Criteria: SDAM class trending away from reference or 20-50% change in mean annual flow/flowing days; vegetation suggests longer wet or dry intervals.

Observation: Major regime shift across lines of evidence.
Criteria: Historically perennial reach now intermittent/ephemeral, >50% change in mean annual flow or flowing days, and vegetation contradicts expected scour/inundation.

Observation: Zero-flow days and dry spells match historical pattern.
Criteria: Stable zero-flow counts and dry-period lengths relative to reference.

Observation: Slight increase in zero-flow days without changing flow class.
Criteria: Minor increase in zero-flow days or short new dry periods.

Observation: New or longer dry periods restrict habitat for weeks.
Criteria: Noticeable increase in zero-flow days or dry-spell length that reduces habitat availability.

Observation: Prolonged cessation shifts expected flow category.
Criteria: Extended dry periods effectively change flow class (e.g., perennial to intermittent).

Observation: IHA metrics and R-B flashiness near reference; no increase in low/zero-flow days.
Criteria: Timing, magnitude, pulse frequency, and rise/fall rates within reference ranges; stable-flow windows intact.

Observation: One or two IHA groups show modest departure; R-B slightly higher.
Criteria: Small shifts in timing or pulse frequency; low-flow days increase only slightly.

Observation: Several IHA components and R-B show clear departure.
Criteria: More frequent surges, shorter stable-flow periods, and noticeable increases in low or zero-flow days.

Observation: Most IHA metrics outside reference; R-B much higher.
Criteria: Seasonal timing lost or shifted; extended low-flow or dry periods change expected flow duration class.

Observation: No major regulating structures or inputs affecting the reach.
Criteria: No dams, levees, or diversions; IHA components generally within reference.

Observation: One small structure or minor diversion with limited local effects.
Criteria: Localized regulation or slight departures in IHA components.

Observation: One or two moderate structures or diversions noticeably alter flows.
Criteria: Reduced floodplain access, altered baseflow, or shifted seasonal timing.

Observation: Multiple or large structures strongly regulate or dewater.
Criteria: Flattened peaks, daily stage swings, or widespread IHA departures.

Observation: Measurable low-flow velocity with steady movement; no stagnation.
Criteria: Velocity near reference for stream type (e.g., ~0.05-0.10 m/s in higher-gradient streams).

Observation: Slightly reduced velocities with small stagnant pockets.
Criteria: Minor reduction in velocity; movement persists through most of reach.

Observation: Very low or near-stagnant velocities in a normally flowing reach.
Criteria: Only slight thalweg movement; debris often stalls in pools or runs.

Observation: Widespread stagnation or no visible movement.
Criteria: Negligible low-flow velocity; scum or odor present.

Observation: Continuous wetted thread with short dry patches; pools hold water.
Criteria: Wetted length >75% or exposed bed <25%, or Q90/Q10 within ~20% of reference.

Observation: Several dry riffles but pools connected; moderate depth.
Criteria: Wetted length about 50-75% or exposed bed 25-50%, or Q90/Q10 within ~20-30% of reference.

Observation: Mostly isolated pools with narrow trickles; shallow depths.
Criteria: Wetted length about 25-50% or exposed bed 50-75%, or Q90/Q10 differ ~30-50%.

Observation: Disconnected, very shallow pools; bed mostly exposed.
Criteria: Wetted length <25% or exposed bed >75%, or Q90/Q10 differ >50%.

Observation: Most residual pools connected with continuous wetted thalweg.
Criteria: >75% of pools connected; few or no dry gaps.

Observation: Some dry gaps but many pools still linked.
Criteria: About 50-75% of pools connected with short dry gaps.

Observation: Several dry gaps; many pools isolated.
Criteria: About 25-50% connected; riffles mostly dry.

Observation: Long dry segments; pools isolated.
Criteria: <25% connected; no continuous surface flow.

Observation: Water contacts both banks along most of the reach; lateral pockets connected.
Criteria: Most margins wetted with few dry shelves; small pockets remain connected.

Observation: Banks wetted in many places but intermittent dry shelves.
Criteria: Some benches/backwaters connected while others are dry.

Observation: Long dry shelves common; only scattered wetted edges.
Criteria: Most lateral pockets disconnected except during storms.

Observation: Banks largely dry; narrow central thread only.
Criteria: Lateral pockets and benches mostly dry or isolated.

Observation: Recent moderate events inundate low benches and side bars. Field stakes at bankfull are inundated about every other year.
Criteria: Floodplain activation ~1-2 yr

Observation: Benches inundated in a few recent years but not consistently.
Criteria: Activation ~3-5 yr

Observation: Only larger, less frequent events reach benches. Benches are dusty or vegetated with upland species.
Criteria: Activation ~5-10 yr

Observation: Benches rarely or never wet. Levees or incision isolate the floodplain except during extremes.
Criteria: Activation rare except large floods

Observation: Bankfull width and depth closely match regional curves for the drainage area and slope. Bars and banks remain stable through ~1-2 yr flows.
Criteria: Near regional curve; stable

Observation: Slightly oversized or undersized relative to curves. Isolated bank slumps after moderate events.
Criteria: Mild departure; occasional instability

Observation: Noticeable mismatch to curves. Frequent bar growth or cutbank retreat after moderate events.
Criteria: Significant departure; frequent instability

Observation: Highly out of family. Repeated blowouts, chute formation, or bank failures with moderate floods.
Criteria: Severe departure; chronic instability

Observation: Velocity and shear match what the bed can resist. Only small bar tweaks or thin new deposits.
Criteria: Near threshold; stable

Observation: Small scour spots or minor deposition in a few places.
Criteria: Slight mismatch; occasional instability

Observation: Velocity and shear noticeably too high or too low. Bars grow, shift, or scour around structures after moderate flows.
Criteria: Significant mismatch; frequent instability

Observation: Widespread bank retreat, channel shifts, or large sediment deposits after moderate flows.
Criteria: Extreme mismatch; chronic instability

Observation: Painted tracers or pebble counts indicate surface mobility near bankfull. Historic records show similar behavior.
Criteria: Motion near bankfull (~1-2 yr)

Observation: Motion occurs somewhat below or above bankfull. Habitat still diverse but trending.
Criteria: Slightly off

Observation: Bed stays locked through multiple moderate floods, or mobilizes during sub-bankfull flows every season.
Criteria: Often locked or often scoured

Observation: Bed rarely moves even in large events, or reworks dramatically during modest events.
Criteria: Extreme mismatch

Observation: Multiple active side channels, backwaters, and oxbows exchange flow during moderate floods. Field photos confirm inundation paths.
Criteria: Several off-channel features connected at ~1-2 year stage; pattern resembles historical complexity.

Observation: Some side channels remain but several are truncated by berms or levees. Connectivity occurs only in parts of the reach.
Criteria: Partial complexity. Some features are disconnected at moderate floods.

Observation: Only a small backwater remains. Most historic features are isolated or filled.
Criteria: Most side channels lost or isolated. Minimal diversity of floodplain features.

Observation: Both banks are leveed or the reach is straightened and dredged. No off-channel areas remain despite historical evidence.
Criteria: Drastically simplified or leveed. No functional off-channel areas.

Observation: LiDAR cross-sections show flood-prone width more than 2.2 times bankfull width.
Representative cross-section yields ER ~ 1.7.
Three cross-sections yield ER ~ 1.2.
Channel is walled or deeply incised with little widening at flood-prone elevation.
Criteria: ER near 1.0 and confinement by levees or walls.

Observation: No levees or spoil banks. Sinuous planform. No signs of dredging.
Criteria: Stable channel. Not incised or dredged. Frequent floodplain access.

Observation: Short straightened segment and intermittent spoil berm on one bank.
Criteria: Slight channelization or partial dredging.

Observation: Reach is incised by about 1-2 m with continuous spoil banks on one or both banks.
Criteria: Heavily modified or incised with limited floodplain access.

Observation: Recently dredged trapezoidal channel with levees along both banks.
Criteria: Deeply dredged or fully channelized. No functional floodplain.

Observation: HEC-RAS 2D shows the floodplain and backwaters inundate at ~Q2 with 0.3-0.6 m depths.
Criteria: 1-2 year floods inundate side and backwaters.

Observation: Inundation begins near ~Q3-Q5 with patchy coverage.
Criteria: 3-5 year floods required for broad access.

Observation: Little inundation until ~Q10. Backwaters remain dry in moderate events.
Criteria: ~10 year event needed for access.

Observation: No inundation until very large floods because of levees and incision.
Criteria: Only extreme events produce inundation.

Observation: Alternating riffle-pool sequence. Distinct head drops at riffles. Patchy dunes in sand-bed reaches.
Criteria: Well-developed bedforms with obvious upwelling and downwelling zones.

Observation: Some riffles and shallow pools but long uniform runs between.
Criteria: Bedform variety present but partially uniform.

Observation: Mostly long runs. Few weak riffles.
Criteria: Mostly uniform habitat with limited exchange features.

Observation: Featureless, planar bed with silt cover.
Criteria: Bed lacks form. Exchange likely negligible.

Observation: Hand-textured sands and sandy loams in frequently inundated swales. Groundwater mounding observed after floods.
Criteria: Predominantly permeable floodplain soils supporting subsurface flow.

Observation: Mixed sand over clay. Localized perched layers.
Criteria: Partially permeable. Some clogging layers.

Observation: Clayey overbank deposits or shallow bedrock exposed.
Criteria: Mostly fine or shallow bedrock that limits infiltration.

Observation: Spoil berms or compacted fill along banks.
Criteria: Heavily compacted or lined. Minimal subsurface exchange.

Observation: Pebble count shows clean gravel-cobble with open interstices.
Criteria: Fines < 25%. Low embeddedness.

Observation: Some fine matrix visible between gravels.
Criteria: Fines 25-50%. Moderate embeddedness.

Observation: Gravels largely buried by sand/silt.
Criteria: Fines 50-75%. High embeddedness.

Observation: Bed surface mostly sand, silt, or consolidated fines.
Criteria: Fines >75%. Very high embeddedness.

Observation: Multiple small upwelling boils at pool tails. Cold seeps along margins during summer.
Criteria: Clear, frequent indicators of sub-surface flow.

Observation: One or two seeps noted. Weak infiltration on riffle crests.
Criteria: Occasional indicators.

Observation: Questionable features. Staining but no active upwelling observed.
Criteria: Rare or uncertain indicators.

Observation: No seeps or infiltration zones observed at baseflow or falling limb.
Criteria: No evidence. Bed appears sealed or compacted.

Observation: Low, vegetated banks. Frequent overbanking near bankfull. No fresh downcutting.
Criteria: Schumm Stage I or VI. Cluer & Thorne stages 0-1 or 6-8.

Observation: Point bars rebuilding. Patchy inset benches forming. Short raw segments remain.
Criteria: Schumm Stage V or mid-range in Cluer & Thorne.

Observation: Fresh slumps common. Bed appears lowered relative to floodplain.
Criteria: Schumm Stage III-IV.

Observation: Deeply entrenched cross-section with tall raw banks. Active knickpoint present.
Criteria: Schumm Stage II or destructive phases.

Observation: No headcuts mapped in imagery or field. Old steps fully vegetated.
Criteria: No active headcuts.

Observation: One small local knickpoint at a tributary junction with little change between dates.
Criteria: Localized feature with limited progression.

Observation: Headcut with fresh plunge pool and exposed strata observed in two locations. Upstream migration evident between image years.
Criteria: One to two moderate, actively migrating headcuts.

Observation: Several large headcuts marching upstream across the reach with widespread bank failures above cuts.
Criteria: Multiple or large active headcuts with rapid advance.

Observation: Digitized edges show minor width change over a decade. Bars and banks behave like nearby reference reaches.
Criteria: Near-reference lateral change.

Observation: Mild net widening over 10 years with occasional raw banks and quick revegetation.
Criteria: Slightly above reference change.

Observation: Width increased well beyond reference. Frequent mass failures or pronounced confinement in places.
Criteria: Significantly above or below reference with instability or constraints.

Observation: Rapid over-widening after storms, or planform fully locked by hardening that suppresses natural change.
Criteria: Highly accelerated or heavily suppressed outside stable norms.

Observation: Continuous inset benches on both banks with established woody and herbaceous cover.
Criteria: Broad, established vegetated benches or inset floodplains.

Observation: Patchy vegetated bars and short bench segments. Vegetation is establishing.
Criteria: Noticeable but incomplete bench and bar formation.

Observation: Narrow, mostly bare bars. Few inset surfaces. Fresh erosion visible.
Criteria: Sparse new floodplain surfaces and limited vegetation.

Observation: No benches or inset floodplains. Vertical raw banks dominate.
Criteria: No meaningful signs of recovery.

Observation: Well-vegetated banks with low BEHI; few raw spots.
Criteria: Only small, scattered eroding segments that recover quickly.

Observation: Patchy vegetation and moderate BEHI; some raw or slumping sections.
Criteria: Noticeable but limited eroding length.

Observation: Many long raw sections; high BEHI; widespread erosion.
Criteria: Large portions of bankline actively eroding or failing.

Observation: Very high BEHI; >50% bankline eroding or failing; failing armor.
Criteria: Extensive bare/slumped banks and deteriorating protection.

Observation: Slow, natural bend movement matches nearby reference.
Criteria: Cutoffs rare; migration rate near reference.

Observation: Slightly faster or constrained migration; occasional cutoffs.
Criteria: Minor departure from reference behavior.

Observation: Noticeably accelerated migration or several cutoffs in recent decades.
Criteria: Migration about 2-3x reference or chute cutoffs common.

Observation: Very rapid migration, avulsions, or channel jumps.
Criteria: Frequent or large cutoffs; path strongly out of character for setting.

Observation: Meanders occupy valley floor; bars well developed.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.2-1.5 or matches local reference.

Observation: Gentle bends with long straight runs.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.1-1.2.

Observation: Mostly straight with infrequent bends.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.05-1.1.

Observation: Channelized or straight through a meander belt.
Criteria: Sinuosity <1.05 where meanders are expected.

Observation: Planform natural for valley; expected thread count; side channels connected.
Criteria: Little/no straightening; side channels carry water near bankfull; pattern matches reference.

Observation: Some simplified segments but generally natural.
Criteria: Minor realignment or slight thread-count departure; limited side-channel connectivity.

Observation: Clear realignment or planform departure; side channels mostly inactive.
Criteria: Long straight segments or mismatched thread count; side channels disconnected except larger floods.

Observation: Heavily straightened or artificial planform.
Criteria: Strongly out of character; side channels absent or blocked by berms/spoil/levees.

Observation: Point bars present on bends. No persistent mid-channel bars.
Criteria: Bar types and locations match expected reference for a single-thread meandering channel (Leopold et al., 1964).

Observation: Small lateral bars and occasional temporary islands.
Criteria: Minor departures from reference pattern.

Observation: Multiple mid-channel bars that persist year to year and split flow.
Criteria: Pattern suggests imbalance in supply vs transport for expected channel type (Bridge 2003).

Observation: Reach clogged with large deposits that force multi-threading where not natural.
Criteria: Widespread bar growth inconsistent with reference condition.

Observation: Low banks with inset benches. No active headcuts observed.
Criteria: ER > 2.2. No active headcuts (Rosgen 1996, 2006).

Observation: Localized bed lowering. One small headcut with vegetation establishing.
Criteria: ER ~1.4-2.2. Limited headcut activity (Rosgen 1996, 2006).

Observation: High banks and lowered bed. One to two moderate headcuts migrating.
Criteria: ER < 1.4. Observable upstream migration of headcuts (Simon & Rinaldi 2006).

Observation: Multiple large active headcuts. Floodplain largely disconnected.
Criteria: ER < 1.4 reach-wide. Widespread incision (Schumm et al., 1984; Rosgen 2006).

Observation: Gravel-cobble riffles with open voids. Thin or absent silt film.
Criteria: Embeddedness < 25% (Class 1) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

Observation: Some fines in pools and along margins. Riffles mostly clean.
Criteria: Embeddedness 25-50% (Class 2) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

Observation: Riffles partly blanketed in silt after storms. Fines persist for weeks.
Criteria: Embeddedness 50-75% (Class 3) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

Observation: Substrate largely buried in fines. Chronic turbidity even at low flow.
Criteria: Embeddedness > 75% (Class 4) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

Observation: Bars form on inner bends and migrate gradually. Pools maintained.
Criteria: Bankfull Shields stress ~0.03-0.06 and consistent with D50. Morphology shows balanced scour/fill (Buffington & Montgomery 1997).

Observation: Modest bar growth in low-energy sections. Some narrowing.
Criteria: Shields slightly below critical range. Minor deposition.

Observation: Large new bars in straight sections. Pools infilling.
Criteria: Shields well below critical range. Under-capacity relative to supply.

Observation: Deep scour and exposed armor. Few bars remain.
Criteria: Shields well above critical range. Persistent over-capacity (Knighton 1998).

Observation: Abundant large wood with key pieces/rootwads or small jams.
Criteria: Meets upper-range reference for density and variety.

Observation: Moderate wood; some larger pieces but patchy.
Criteria: Slightly below reference; habitat added but less consistent.

Observation: Very little wood; mostly small/decayed pieces.
Criteria: Few or no key pieces; limited hydraulic influence.

Observation: Almost no large wood where expected.
Criteria: No key pieces or jams; far below reference unless naturally low wood.

Observation: Continuous >=30 m mature forest on both banks.
Criteria: Strong recruitment potential within ~30 m corridor.

Observation: 15-30 m forested buffer with gaps or one bank narrower.
Criteria: Partial coverage; recruitment reduced.

Observation: Narrow (<15 m) or patchy trees with frequent breaks.
Criteria: Few large stems near channel.

Observation: No meaningful near-channel forest where forest is natural.
Criteria: Grass/crops/development to top of bank; minimal recruitment.

Observation: Gravel-cobble mix with low fines and open pore space.
Criteria: <25% embeddedness; little/no crusting or armor.

Observation: Slight fines or coarsening; moderate embeddedness.
Criteria: Embeddedness about 25-50%; light crusting/armoring.

Observation: Fines blanket bed or strong armor limits pore space.
Criteria: Embeddedness about 50-75% or surface locked.

Observation: Fine-dominated bed or heavily locked armor.
Criteria: Embeddedness >75% or severe armoring; minimal pore space.

Observation: Clear riffle-run-pool or step-pool sequence at expected spacing.
Criteria: Robust bedform variety for stream type.

Observation: Some diversity but units less distinct or irregular spacing.
Criteria: Partially uniform bed with intermittent units.

Observation: Mostly homogeneous bed; sequences faint or discontinuous.
Criteria: Minimal expression of expected units.

Observation: Flattened or artificially uniform bed.
Criteria: No meaningful bedform sequence.

Observation: Closed canopy of mature hardwoods and conifers. Continuous overchannel foliage.
Criteria: 75-100% shade where forested reference conditions are expected.

Observation: Mixed canopy with gaps near crossings and meadows.
Criteria: 50-75% shade.

Observation: Fragmented tree line with long open reaches beside pasture.
Criteria: 25-50% shade.

Observation: Cleared banks and open valley floor in a historically forested setting.
Criteria: <25% shade. Note that excessive shade would be flagged only in historically open systems.

Observation: Logger record shows summer highs below local standard. Small diel range.
Criteria: Rarely surpasses local standard. For screening, <20 C in coldwater or <28 C in warmwater.

Observation: Occasional brief exceedances during heat waves.
Criteria: Slightly exceeds threshold occasionally.

Observation: Repeated warm afternoons near or over the threshold each week.
Criteria: Frequent near or over threshold.

Observation: Daily exceedance and several events approaching lethal levels.
Criteria: Consistently high or lethal temperatures.

Observation: Thin periphyton film on stable cobbles. No mats.
Criteria: Minimal algae. No nuisance mats.

Observation: Light filaments on sunlit margins.
Criteria: Slightly elevated algae coverage.

Observation: Broad patches of filamentous algae covering riffles.
Criteria: Large mats partially impair habitat.

Observation: Thick blooms and scums that blanket the bed and trap fine sediment.
Criteria: Dense bloom or scum overshadowing substrate.

Observation: Multiple cold seeps and deep pools evident. Fish aggregations present on hot days.
Criteria: Multiple cooler pockets or deeper pools moderating temperature extremes.

Observation: One small spring-fed side channel with limited extent.
Criteria: One to two minor or limited refuges.

Observation: Scattered weak cool spots with little depth refuge.
Criteria: Rare or minimal cooler zones. Partial stress.

Observation: No detectable cool pockets in a reach that historically had springs or deep pools.
Criteria: No refuges where historically expected. High thermal risk.

Observation: Stable leaf packs lodged behind wood and in low-velocity pockets along most of the reach
Criteria: Abundant CPOM retention and multiple debris accumulations typical for forested systems

Observation: Leaf packs present but many flush out after moderate storms
Criteria: Some retention with partial flushing

Observation: Only scattered leaves on bars or in eddies. Bed often scoured clean
Criteria: Sparse organic matter and limited retention

Observation: Bed largely bare with thin organic film or black, anoxic conditions
Criteria: No effective retention or severe overload causing anoxia

Indicator: Detritus Decomposition Rate, Shredder/ Detritivore Presence
Observation: Leaf packs break down quickly with softening and visible fungal growth. Kick sample includes several shredder taxa
Criteria: Fast breakdown with strong biological processing and multiple shredder groups present

Indicator: Detritus Decomposition Rate, Shredder/ Detritivore Presence
Observation: Moderate softening of leaves with some fungal growth. One or two shredder groups present at low abundance
Criteria: Intermediate breakdown with partial shredder presence

Indicator: Detritus Decomposition Rate, Shredder/ Detritivore Presence
Observation: Little change to leaf material after several weeks. Packs often coated in silt. Assemblage mostly tolerant collectors and grazers
Criteria: Slow breakdown with few or no active shredders

Indicator: Detritus Decomposition Rate, Shredder/ Detritivore Presence
Observation: No noticeable mass loss. Strong odor or anoxic conditions. No shredders in a reach where they are expected
Criteria: Very slow breakdown and absence of shredder taxa in suitable habitat

Observation: Continuous native trees and shrubs on both banks at about 30 m or more
Criteria: Approximately >= 30 m native buffer. Diverse structure

Observation: Mostly vegetated but interrupted by lawns or crossings. About 15-30 m
Criteria: 15-30 m with partial native cover

Observation: Narrow grass strip or mowed edges. About 5-15 m
Criteria: 5-15 m and limited native diversity

Observation: Cropland, pavement, or fill to the top of bank. Less than 5 m
Criteria: < 5 m or essentially no corridor

Observation: Thin biofilm with visible gravel and cobble. No mats
Criteria: Balanced growth and no nuisance bloom

Observation: Slight periphyton increase. Occasional filament clusters
Criteria: Slightly elevated algae

Observation: Frequent moderate mats in glides and pools
Criteria: Moderate nuisance mats that partially impair habitat

Observation: Thick mats or scums widespread. Substrate obscured
Criteria: Dense blooms overshadowing habitat

Observation: Cobble substrate mostly clean. Thin biofilm only.
Criteria: < 10% benthic algal cover

Observation: Thin green filaments on stones in patches.
Criteria: ~10-30% cover

Observation: Mats cover about one third to one half of riffles.
Criteria: ~30-50% cover

Observation: Thick mats and surface scum on most substrate.
Criteria: > 50% cover or nuisance mats

Observation: TN ~0.5 mg/L and TP ~0.03 mg/L.
Criteria: Near low to moderate trophic benchmarks
Slightly elevated nutrients
Marked elevation

Observation: TN > 1.5 mg/L or TP > 0.10 mg/L.
Criteria: Strong enrichment

Observation: Continuous native forest buffer on both banks.
Criteria: >= ~30 m width per bank

Observation: Mostly vegetated buffer with gaps.
Narrow buffer with frequent breaks.
Cropped or paved to bank edge.
Connected floodplain wetlands with hydric soils and backwater pockets.
Criteria: Strong potential with frequent seasonal saturation

Observation: Some wet pockets. Channel partly disconnected from floodplain.
Criteria: Moderate potential

Observation: Limited wetland area. Bankfull rarely overtops.
Criteria: Low potential

Observation: No wetlands. Floodplain ditched or tile drained.
Criteria: Negligible potential

Observation: Water is clear at baseflow and similar to a local reference reach. Bottom is visible at knee depth.
Criteria: Mostly clear or only slightly cloudy at baseflow.

Observation: Slight yellow-brown tint after storms that clears within a day.
Criteria: Slight turbidity or color that is short-lived.

Observation: Cloudy water persists during baseflow. Fine sediment coats substrate.
Criteria: Persistent cloudiness at baseflow.

Observation: Chronically muddy water. Visible oily sheen or scum in slack water.
Criteria: Persistently muddy or sheen present.

Observation: DO readings consistently above 6 mg/L. No recorded night-time dips.
Criteria: > 6 mg/L consistently.

Observation: DO commonly 5-6 mg/L in late summer.
Criteria: 5-6 mg/L borderline.

Observation: Night minima 3-5 mg/L during warm periods.
Criteria: 3-5 mg/L frequent stress.

Observation: DO dips below 3 mg/L and fish stress observed.
Criteria: < 3 mg/L dangerously low.

Observation: No oily sheen, staining, or chemical odor. Soils appear natural and intact. No impairment listings.
Criteria: No visible contamination indicators or known exceedances.

Observation: Occasional faint odor near a storm outfall or small dump pile on the floodplain.
Criteria: Minor localized inputs or mild odor only.

Observation: Stained soils, debris, or chemical odor near developed or industrial areas. Located downstream of a listed contaminated site.
Criteria: Recognized contamination risk or known moderate contamination.

Observation: Strong odor, visible seepage, or listed hazardous site on the floodplain. Fish kill reports on record.
Criteria: Severe or chronic contamination.

Observation: pH 7.4. Specific conductance 250 uS/cm.
Criteria: pH ~6.5-8.5 and cond. < 500 uS/cm typical.

Observation: pH 6.3 or 8.7 with otherwise stable chemistry.
Criteria: Slightly off-range or mild elevation.

Observation: pH 5.8 or 9.2. Conductivity ~1000 uS/cm.
Criteria: Marked deviation or 800-1500 uS/cm.

Observation: pH 4.8 or 10.2. Conductivity > 2000 uS/cm.
Criteria: Extreme pH or very high conductance.

Observation: Intact native soils and vegetation. No odors or staining.
Criteria: Natural soils. No contamination indicators.

Observation: Small dump pile or localized manure near a crossing.
Criteria: Minor dumping or localized inputs.

Observation: Stained soils and debris on banks near former industrial area.
Criteria: Known moderate contamination.

Observation: Strong petroleum odor, visible seepage, or listed hazardous site on the floodplain.
Criteria: Highly contaminated soils.

Observation: Riffles, runs, pools, and large wood recur across the reach.
Criteria: Multiple habitat types well represented.

Observation: Riffle and run common. Pools intermittent. Sparse cover.
Criteria: Some variety but missing key elements.

Observation: Long uniform glide or sand bed with occasional shallow run.
Criteria: Mostly uniform. Only 1-2 distinct features.

Observation: Straight, entrenched, uniform channel with little cover.
Criteria: Very uniform channel. Limited structural diversity.

Observation: Thick root mats and overhanging shrubs along outside bends.
Criteria: About 50% or more of banks provide undercut or overhanging cover.

Observation: Intermittent undercuts and low branches in meanders.
Criteria: About 25-50% cover.

Observation: Short isolated undercut pockets. Many bare or armored banks.
Criteria: About 10-25% cover.

Observation: Banks straight and hardened. Little to no overhanging vegetation.
Criteria: <10% cover.

Observation: Stable cobble riffles with gravel pockets, root wads, leaf packs, and scattered wood.
Criteria: Multiple stable substrates and organic cover supporting diverse invertebrates.

Observation: Cobble and gravel with some roots or wood. Fines cover parts of the bed.
Criteria: Some substrate variety but partly limited by fines.

Observation: Mostly mobile sand or silt with little wood or leaf packs.
Criteria: Limited stable substrate and few microhabitats.

Observation: Uniform sand, silt, or bedrock. No wood, leaf packs, or root structure.
Criteria: Very poor substrate variety and minimal invertebrate habitat.

Observation: Side channels and backwaters connect during seasonal highs. Fish and amphibian use observed.
Criteria: Well connected off-channel areas offering refuge and spawning.

Observation: One or two backwaters with partial seasonal connection.
Criteria: Some partial connection.

Observation: Small depressions connect only during rare floods.
Criteria: Rare or only ephemeral off-channel usage.

Observation: Levees or berms isolate the channel from the floodplain.
Criteria: No side channels or backwaters remain.

Observation: Clean gravels with open spaces and many shallow pockets, wood, and vegetation.
Criteria: Embeddedness 0-25 percent; over 40 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

Observation: Light sand on riffles; scattered wood and bank cover.
Criteria: Embeddedness 25-50 percent; about 20-40 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

Observation: Gravels embedded with silt; few bank pockets or calm margins.
Criteria: Embeddedness 50-75 percent; about 5-20 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

Observation: Bed mostly sand or silt; no pockets or structural cover.
Criteria: Embeddedness >=75 percent; less than 5 percent shallow, low-velocity cover.

Observation: Mayflies, stoneflies, and caddisflies found in kick sample.
Criteria: All three EPT orders present with multiple taxa.

Observation: Two of three EPT orders present.
Criteria: Two EPT orders present.

Observation: Only one EPT order present.
Criteria: One EPT order present.

Observation: No EPT. Mostly tolerant midges and worms.
Criteria: Zero EPT orders present.

Observation: Several native species across many sizes.
Criteria: Multiple native species with broad size classes.

Observation: Two to three natives; sizes limited.
Criteria: Few natives with partial size classes.

Observation: Only tolerant species present in low numbers.
Criteria: One to two tolerant species dominate.

Observation: No fish detected where expected.
Criteria: Absent or only non-native species present.

Observation: Multiple frogs, salamanders, and crayfish observed.
Criteria: Presence aligns with reference expectations.

Observation: A few individuals observed.
Criteria: Limited presence.

Observation: One or two sightings only.
Criteria: Rare occurrence.

Observation: None detected during suitable season.
Criteria: Absent where historically expected.

Observation: Native fish and invertebrates common. Very few non natives seen.
Criteria: Native community matches reference. Non natives rare and low abundance.

Observation: Most natives present. Some sensitive species missing.
Criteria: Minor native loss. Non natives present but natives still dominant.

Observation: Many sensitive natives gone. Non natives frequent.
Criteria: Noticeable native decline. Non natives common or co-dominant.

Observation: Only tolerant or non native species observed.
Criteria: Natives rare or absent. Community dominated by tolerant or invasive taxa.

Observation: Many species across several feeding groups.
Criteria: High richness. Balanced feeding groups. Good index score.

Observation: Several species present. Some groups missing.
Criteria: Moderate richness. Some imbalance in feeding groups.

Observation: Few species. One or two groups dominate.
Criteria: Low richness. Dominance by tolerant taxa or single group.

Observation: Very few species. Mostly tolerant taxa.
Criteria: Extremely low richness and diversity. Poor index score.

Observation: Continuous native trees, shrubs, and groundcover.
Criteria: Wide, intact native corridor with minimal invasives.

Observation: Mostly vegetated corridor with some gaps.
Criteria: Moderate width and structure. Some invasive patches present.

Observation: Thin or patchy vegetation along banks.
Criteria: Narrow corridor. Fragmented native cover with common invasives.

Observation: Little native vegetation. Banks mostly lawn or invasives.
Criteria: Corridor very narrow or absent. Native plants largely missing.

Observation: Beaver, mussels, or crayfish common where expected.
Criteria: Expected keystone taxa widespread. No invasive dominance.

Observation: Some keystone species present but patchy.
Criteria: At least one keystone taxon present but limited distribution.

Observation: Keystone species observed only in small numbers.
Criteria: Keystone taxa rare compared to reference or historical levels.

Observation: Expected keystone species absent. Invasives common.
Criteria: No keystone taxa present. Strong invasive dominance.

Observation: No dams or weirs within the connected corridor. Only small natural steps that fish pass at typical flows.
Criteria: 80-100% of habitat accessible. No major barriers.

Observation: One small low-head structure downstream with partial passage at moderate flows.
Criteria: About 50-80% accessible.

Observation: Several small barriers in series restrict movement across subreaches.
Criteria: About 20-50% accessible.

Observation: Large regulating dam close to the reach with multiple downstream grade controls.
Criteria: <20% accessible due to big dams or multiple blockages.

Observation: Crossings are embedded and aligned with natural bed. No outlet drops.
Criteria: 80-100% stream continuity at crossings.

Observation: Most crossings passable. A few show minor outlet drops or smooth barrels.
Criteria: About 50-80% passable.

Observation: Several perched culverts and steep barrels concentrate flow and block passage.
Criteria: About 20-50% passable.

Observation: Many perched pipes and long smooth boxes with no bed material.
Criteria: <20% passable. Multiple perched culverts hamper movement.

Observation: Banks are free of continuous levees or walls. Side channels and backwaters are accessible.
Criteria: No major levees or walls. Free lateral movement for semiaquatic fauna.

Observation: Short levee segments occur, but frequent gaps allow movement to wetlands.
Criteria: Some partial barriers but still some access.

Observation: Long levees or ripraped banks on one side limit access to the floodplain in many places.
Criteria: Large levees hamper movement in many areas.

Observation: Both banks armored or walled for long distances. Few or no access points.
Criteria: Heavily walled or leveed corridor. Minimal lateral connectivity.

Observation: Continuous wetted channel during the expected season. No artificial withdrawals noted.
Criteria: No artificial dryness. Natural connectivity is maintained.

Observation: Short dry patches appear during late season but reconnect after small rains.
Criteria: Minor dryness in small segments.

Observation: Long dry segments form in critical habitat areas during the growing season.
Criteria: Notable dryness or disconnection in key reaches.

Observation: Reaches are chronically dewatered or disconnected for long periods due to withdrawals or diversions.
Criteria: Chronic or large-scale dewatering. Major fragmentation.
